intro: Aconitum pycnanthum, commonly known as the meadow aconite, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height. The plant produces showy blue to purple flowers in late summer, arranged in dense clusters at the top of the stem. Its leaves are palmately compound, with finely divided lobes, and the plant prefers moist, well-drained soils in woodland or meadow habitats. Aconitum pycnanthum contains toxic alkaloids and should be handled with care.
